page.title: 10ST.MICHAEL and ALL ANGELS
page.content: The first church was built in 700 AD by monks who lived in a priory nearby. In 1170 the{ BISHOP}of {WORCESTER decided to make a summer residence in {BISHOP'S CLEEVE.}He wanted a grander church so a Norman building replaced the simple Saxon one.In 1300 a chancel was built for the monks to have their own services.In 1680 the church tower fell down due to unstable foundations and was rebuilt by the end of the century.There is now a programme of restoration.Weathered Norman carvings are to be recarved.In the tower there are eight bells.The church has to be locked now because of vandalism.Each year Â£26,000 must be raised for church expenses.Recently congregations have increased and more sevices will be in- troduced for different age groups. A full time rector and curate run it.
